alert.note: Alert for Casey; Lincoln (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Lincoln and northeastern Casey Counties through 1130 PM EDT... At 1044 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Liberty, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Lincoln and northeastern Casey Counties, including the following locations... South Fork, Lawhorn Hill, Kings Mountain, New Salem, Mount Salem, Bethelridge, Walltown, Middleburg, Lanhamtown and Waynesburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm. Do not drive your vehicle through standing water.
